channel.title: philstar.com - RSS Headlines
channel.description: Philippine News for the Filipino Global Community

item.title: Life After Lockdown: Move to digital a huge trial for courtrooms, law enforcement agencies
item.author: Kristine Joy Patag
item.description: (Updated) Reduced physical interactions do not mean essential institutions like the legal and justice system can stop working.

item.title: Roque: 'No draconian provisions' in Anti-Terror Bill inspired by US, UK laws
item.description: Presidential spokesperson Harry Roque said the Philippines has the loosest anti-terrorism law in the world.

item.title: COVID-19 infections in Philippines approach 19,000 with addition of 359 cases
item.author: Gaea Katreena Cabico
item.description: Metro Manila—the epicenter of the country’s outbreak—began emerging from one of the world’s longest coronavirus lockdowns Monday after most businesses were allowed to reopen for the first time since mid-March.

item.title: LOOK: Design student crafts mobile app, PWD card system for thesis project
item.author: Franco Luna
item.description: "I wanted to empower PWDs by upgrading to a system that makes it more efficient and accessible for them," she wrote.

item.title: SC rejects Gadon plea vs NTC and House, scolds petitioner
item.author: Kristine Joy Patag
item.description: “Having no legal standing, the Court does not deem it efficient to proceed to deliberate on other issues he raises.”

item.title: Palace reminder: Dine-in services allowed in MGCQ areas 'but don't have a party'
item.author: Gaea Katreena Cabico
item.description: The government’s task force on coronavirus response has allowed the dine-in services of restaurants and fast food chains to operate at 50% capacity in MGCQ areas.

item.title: Despite inadequate transportation, MMDA says commuters 'forgot' quarantine rules at GCQ's onset
item.author: Franco Luna
item.description: Ever since talks of general community quarantine began, government agencies have begun ramping up the narrative that the success of the now-implemented GCQ depended wholly on the cooperation and discipline of the public.

item.title: Government urged to address commuters' woes in shift to GCQ
item.author: Bella Perez-Rubio
item.description: Senators Risa Hontiveros and Nancy Binay on Tuesday urged the government to address the chaotic state of public transport as Metro Manila eases into to a general community quarantine (GCQ).

item.title: Rights lawyers urge public: Voice out rejection of 'Anti-Terror' Bill
item.author: Kristine Joy Patag
item.description: Rights lawyers on Tuesday sound the alarm on the proposed “Anti-Terror” bill and urged the public to reject the “unconstitutional” proposed legislation.

item.title: Extension of Congress session sought to pass 'vital' COVID-19 response bills
item.description: Rep. Rufus Rodriguez (Cagayan de Oro City) filed House Concurrent Resolution 8, seeking to extend the first regular session of the 18th Congress until June 11.
